main event: Multiple observers reported a yellowish white object with varying characteristics in the sky over Walden, N.Y. on several occasions in June 1949.
interesting points: One observer noted the object changed position with respect to the moon,Several witnesses described the object as having a luminous quality similar to multiple light bulbs,One report included a long observation of 3 hours during which the object moved significantly,Discrepancies were noted in the reported direction of flight,The object faded slowly from view, indicating a gradual disappearance.
sighted object: yellowish white object with varying characteristics, including balls of fire
witness description: Various observers including a merchant, an airman, and a soda clerk
